Body: Celeste 64 was made in roughly a week!
Fuji began development on January 30th- 1 day after the source release of Celeste 64!
You can import older versions of Fuji by pressing "Import" below the Instance list.
The most recent version of Fuji is always available by pressing "Download" below the Instance list.
Celeste 64 was released for Celeste's 6 year anniversary!
Madeline's full name is canonically 'Madeline McButts'!
If you dash and then jump quickly, you can go farther than normal!
Madeline's 2-dash hair color was originally green!
Matterhorn is made in the Godot game engine!
This feature only exists to let you know that Matterhorn hasn't frozen.
Celeste 64 was mapped using TrenchBroom, a commonly used tool for making Quake maps.
You can add your own splashes by submitting a pull request (or by editing the local files yourself).
If you run at full speed, turn around, and jump, you go higher! (In C64, that is. YMMV in real life.)
GDScript, the language Matterhorn is written in, is not very good at file IO and doesn't even have a function to unzip a folder. Sorry, I just wanted to rant for a second.
Jumping before a moving platform stops will let you keep the velocity, shooting off at high speeds!
Why did Madeline climb Celeste Mountain? Because she heard the summit was the peak of comedy!
